via @GoogleNews

I want to speak for a moment to those of you who like me were women on the edge of Edge, or MIT Media Lab, or Harvard, or anywhere else Jeffrey Epstein’s filthy money and power may have tainted through the generous cooperation of his science bros.

Experiments show the psychology underlying accepting money from the Jeffrey Epsteins of the world: “People would rather have $99 from a good guy than $100 from a bad guy. However, when the differential becomes big enough, people abandon their principles.” https://t.co/Q7NtmspEoE

"I apologize for my complete ignorance of Google and Nexis" - director of MIT's Media Lab, New York Times editorial board member.

https://t.co/tOK3Y34mwr

All the scientists, almost all of which were, shockingly, men, who took money from Epstein, and also hobnobbed w/ him & helped boost his credibility, need to do a lot more than just apologize (e.g., https://t.co/Ml2xwNOYVC and https://t.co/1WPzlfZeGf)

Solidarity is important, yet people should lay off attacking everyone connected to him.  I’m sure a lot of scientists he met with and funded, were too busy being scientists to get involved in Epstein’s fetishes. Let investigations reveal 🔬 https://t.co/pqtx9ro4Av via @Verge

How odd: in July one media narrative was that Tom Watson had helped foment antisemitism by lending credence to Carl Beech’s false accusations against Lord Janner and he had to resign. Now the media narrative is that Watson is a hero. (Am not a member of Lab party.)
That’s very interesting. I did not know that MIT media Lab chief Joichi Ito traveled to Jeffrey Epstein‘s homes. How exactly is it possible to not know what was going on? https://t.co/7anxqJpiy0

New: Documents and interviews show the Media Lab, already under fire for accepting contributions from Jeffrey Epstein, is being investigated for an apparent violation of state environmental regulations. They paused operations after we asked questions.https://t.co/uvaJ5QHgMg

Of course all these MIT prof’s are rallying behind Ito. OF COURSE THEY ARE! The fact that they see this as a witch hunt against Ito shows just how little they understand how he, and others, perhaps themselves, contributed to the harm of Epstein’s victims.

Jeffrey Epstein, Joi Ito, and a 23 year old woman of courage at the filthy corrupt MIT MEDIA LAB. https://t.co/zf0RWfK782

As with previous MIT letters, this one ignores key issues.
